page.title: 01Musselburgh -The Honest Toun
page.content:
Musselburgh{"The Honest Toun".
Musselburgh is situated a few miles along the coast east of Edinburgh. It's population is 16,600. Before the second world war the main employers were Bruntons (wire mill) with 2,500 employees, Inveresk Cotton Mill with 600 workers and the fishing industry with about 200 workers. Today the cotton mill has closed down and fishing has moved away to bigger ports.
There are about a dozen bus services operating via Musselburgh linking Edinburgh and East Lothian. Housing consists of older houses in Musselburgh and the new housing estates of Stoneybank, Stoneyhill and Whitehill.
